Details of all external vacancies will be posted here as they become
available. If you find nothing that interests you this visit, please call
again. Unfortunately we do not have the resources to hold CVs against possible future vacancies. We can only accept applications quoting a relevant and appropriate vacancy number.
We will aim to provide related internet links but Rothamsted cannot be

if you do not already have it installed.

A catering assistant is required for the Rothamsted Conference Centre and staff restaurant which caters for both staff and visitors. This restaurant provides both breakfast and lunch for a varying amount of people, as well as buffets and sandwiches throughout the day.

This position will require you to work as part of a team whilst also being able to use your own initiative at times and have a good understanding of customer service. Your main duties will be making sandwiches/filled rolls etc for lunchtime service. There will also be external Sandwich Lunches and Finger Buffets to prepare. The candidate will be expected to assist with general cleaning/washing-up throughout the kitchen. At times you will be required to operate a cash register, for which training will be given.
Candidates should be able to communicate effectively with internal and external customers. Some experience in a similar position is desirable.
Normal working hours will be 0830 hrs to 1430 hrs
column2: Monday to Friday with a minimum hourly rate of £6.75.

column1: To register your interest please send your up to date CV and covering letter to the HR Department, Rothamsted Research, Harpenden, Herts AL5 2JQ email:rres.hr@bbsrc.ac.uk.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified physicists, mathematicians and modellers for a post-doctoral position to work on fundamental and applied aspects of models for plant pathogen epidemiology and evolutionary ecology in crop and natural environments.

The candidate will develop their own area of work in discussion with researchers at Rothamsted Research. Application areas can range from pathogen sampling problems and the evolutionary ecology of plant pathogens to invasions of new plant pathogens.
The post will be located in the Biomathematics and Bioinformatics Department under the supervision of Dr Frank van den Bosch with close interactions with internal and external collaborators.

The successful applicant will have a background in modelling, mathematical biology or theoretical plant pathology. Knowledge of methods used in spatial ecology and/or evolutionary ecology would be an advantage. Knowledge of epidemiology and plant pathology would be an advantage. Experience with MatLab/MAPLE and programming experience is essential.
This appointment is full time and within Band 6-PD with a starting salary normally in the region of £24,200 and £27,200 per annum.
Apply by application form only, available with further particulars, from clicking the buttons below or from the HR Group, Rothamsted Research, Harpenden, Herts, AL5 2JQ.

Rothamsted Research wishes to recruit a Bioinformatics Scientist who will take responsibility for developing and supporting software and databases in use by our crop scientists who are dependent on high quality genetic and genomics information.

The person appointed will also be responsible for working closely with a data curator who will need new software and database tools to be able to work productively. The appointee will interact with other bioinformatics staff and would be located in the Bioinformatics Group.

Applicants should be a computer science or biological sciences graduate with previous experience of maintaining and developing bioinformatics software and web-enabled database applications in a Unix environment. Candidates trained in biology must have at lest an MSc in bioinformatics or related subject. Prior experience with PostgreSQL and MySQL would be an advantage. The ideal candidate would be competent in at least two of the following programming languages: Java, Python, Perl, SQL, PHP.
This appointment is full time and within Band 6 with a starting salary normally in the region of £24,200 and £27,200 per annum.
Apply by application form only, available with further particulars, from clicking the buttons below or from the HR Group, Rothamsted Research, Harpenden, Herts, AL5 2JQ.

Rothamsted Research wishes to recruit an experienced Senior Bioinformatics Scientist who will take responsibility for developing and supporting a comparative genetic and genomic data analysis pipeline to be used in a range of crop genomics projects. The person appointed will be responsible for working closely with crop scientists from Rothamsted and other BBSRC research institutes. The appointee will lead a local group of bioinformatics scientists responsible for crop informatics projects and interact closely with other bioinformaticians in other crop science centres. The appointee will interact with other bioinformatics staff and would be located in the Bioinformatics Group.

Applicants should be a postgraduate computer science or biological sciences graduate with significant previous experience maintaining and developing bioinformatics software and web-enabled database applications in a Unix environment. Candidates trained in biology must have at least an MSc in Bioinformatics or related subject. Prior experience with PostgreSQL and MySQL would be an advantage. The ideal candidate would be competent in at least two of the following programming languages: Java, Python, Perl, SQL, PHP. It is expected that successful candidates will be able to demonstrate that they can deliver practical bioinformatics software solutions and have the leadership and communication skills necessary to manage a complex and demanding project involving collaborators across multiple sites and potentially several countries.
The salary will be negotiable depending on the candidate's experience but will be within the range of £29,000 to £41,000 per annum.
Apply by application form only, available with further particulars, from clicking the buttons below or from the HR Group, Rothamsted Research, Harpenden, Herts, AL5 2JQ.

Rothamsted Research Institute is an internationally-renowned research centre engaged in leading-edge agricultural, environmental and plant sciences research, securing funding from a wide range of Government and industrial organisations.

The Contracts Officer is part of a small team that deals with the drafting, analysis and negotiation of research agreements of all types with a wide variety of organisations from both the public and private sectors. The role involves working closely with scientists of all levels and will provide assistance to scientists in taking advantage of research opportunities. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to develop their contractual skills in support of cutting-edge science whilst working on national and international agreements.

The successful candidate will have knowledge of the fundamentals of contract law and a first degree or equivalent, preferably in law. Excellent communication skills and a good level of expertise in Microsoft Office applications are required. Previous experience in a similar role would be an advantage.
A salary of circa £25,000 is available for a suitably qualified/experienced candidate.  Additional benefits include 5 weeks annual leave and a final salary pension scheme.
Apply by application form only, available with further particulars, from clicking the buttons below or from the HR Group, Rothamsted Research, Harpenden, Herts, AL5 2JQ.
